channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

Graffiti street sign corner upland and Goodrich by Goodrich primary school

item.title: Chesterfield Grove (along the wall off Joe the Juice shop around the corner) 2nd complaint, 10th December
item.description:
This is the second complaint filed. The rubbish is still there and it has not been removed. It is a health and safety hazard in regards to vermin and is dangerous to the residents and the wider community.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Chesterfield Grove, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Boot scrapper worn out, 10th December
item.description:
Reported brush on boot scrapper needed replacing bacl in the summer. It is even worse now..no bristles at all and completely overgrown. This is at entrance by Riverside Road (opposite Betterton Drive). Can you please replace this. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 98, Riverside Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large canisters and cans + a long lose cable, 10th December
item.description:
Down leaf field lane near gates are lots of largish canisters & a long black cable coming down from high tree along the railings. Not sure what it is for? On the other side of the road on grass verge, lots of discarded cans.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leafield Lane, North Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lift light broken, 10th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Scott Lidgett Crescent, Bermondsey, Greater London

item.title: Light not working in pitch black alleyway used constantly by commuters, 10th December
item.description:
Lamp post in alleyway adjacent to rear entrance/exit from bexleyheath station. Very dark area with uneven footpath and debris to contend with. Commonly smashed bottles in area / broken glass could cause harm.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bridge Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytip, 10th December
item.description:
At the start of random walk se7 ( Woolwich rd entrance) is a mess , there has been large boxes dumped on the pavement at the start of random walk for weeks, shopping trolleys plus graffiti on the wall it's a mess and needs cleaning up. Thank you

item.title: Fly tipping: shower basin and sacks of rubbish etc, 10th December
item.description:
Apologies for any confusion but half of broken shower basin has now been moved to outside 2 Lawrence Bldgs, along with some sacks of rubbish. The other half of the shower basin has been left on Stoke Newington High Street outside Leo’s Cafe.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Garnham Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Toilet left on corner of street, 10th December
item.description:
Someone has fly tipped a toilet at this corner of ramsgate and atlas mews. There are often things fly tipped here, so I'm sure council is familiar with spot.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ramsgate Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
